alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 3:50PM CDT until April 05 at 4:30PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Davidson County in Middle Tennessee... Northern Williamson County in Middle Tennessee... * Until 430 PM CDT. * At 350 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Fairview, or 16 miles southeast of Dickson, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Franklin, Brentwood, Forest Hills, Oak Hill, Belle Meade, Fairview, Bellevue, Berry Hill, Leipers Fork and Natchez Trace At Highway 96. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 195 and 197, and near mile marker 212. Interstate 65 between mile markers 64 and 82. Interstate 840 between mile markers 8 and 20. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
